This probably was a 4-star hotel when it opened, but not anymore. It's showing the effects of age and deferred maintenance and cleaning. I checked in around 2 am after two long flights, only to be awakened at 8:45 am by hammering in the room directly below mine. The cord on the desk lamp was visibly frayed, which is a fire hazard. There was a straight pin on the floor that I didn't see until the morning. Fortunately I did not step on it. They volunteered to move me immediately to the 18th floor. I had just gotten up, and needed a little time. When I was ready, they then said I had to wait until 2 pm. The time came and went, so I called. Then they'd move to to the 15th floor. No, wait, the 8th floor. I was exhausted due to a lack of sleep and rest and couldn't understand why this was so difficult. Finally I moved to the 8th floor. The TV was broken. The bidet hose was leaking, and had been for awhile, based on the amount of rust on the floor. The sink stopper was broken. There was clearly visible black mold in the bathroom. I reported all these things to management. It began to sound like all I did was complain. To their credit, they fixed everything quickly, which I appreciated. Besides construction noise, otherwise you couldn't hear things from other rooms. You only heard things from the hallway. Thankfully cigarette smoke does not come through the vents into non- smoking rooms. If you use the hand-held shower head, be careful. You could easily spray water all over half the large sink counter area - and people have, judging by the amount of black mold I saw. The hotel is not really near anything. I thought about walking to a nearby mall or store, but there was always so much traffic and construction, and it didn't look too good in terms of walkability. I was staying there because I was attending a conference, and the organizers directed us to stay there. I had breakfast only one day. Breakfast supposedly ended at 10:30 am, and I got there just after 10 am. The server told me to hurry; she kept saying they closed at 10 am. (It is really 10:30 am.) The pickings were slim. Some things were out, some were low, and nothing was being replaced. I got the dregs.

This probably was a 4-star hotel when it opened, but not anymore. It's showing the effects of age and deferred maintenance and cleaning. I checked in around 2 am after two long flights, only to be awakened at 8:45 am by hammering in the room directly below mine. The cord on the desk lamp was visibly frayed, which is a fire hazard. There was a straight pin on the floor that I didn't see until the morning. Fortunately I did not step on it. They volunteered to move me immediately to the 18th floor. I had just gotten up, and needed a little time. When I was ready, they then said I had to wait until 2 pm. The time came and went, so I called. Then they'd move to to the 15th floor. No, wait, the 8th floor. I was exhausted due to a lack of sleep and rest and couldn't understand why this was so difficult. Finally I moved to the 8th floor. The TV was broken. The bidet hose was leaking, and had been for awhile, based on the amount of rust on the floor. The sink stopper was broken. There was clearly visible black mold in the bathroom. I reported all these things to management. It began to sound like all I did was complain. To their credit, they fixed everything quickly, which I appreciated. Besides construction noise, otherwise you couldn't hear things from other rooms. You only heard things from the hallway. Thankfully cigarette smoke does not come through the vents into non- smoking rooms. If you use the hand-held shower head, be careful. You could easily spray water all over half the large sink counter area - and people have, judging by the amount of black mold I saw. The hotel is not really near anything. I thought about walking to a nearby mall or store, but there was always so much traffic and construction, and it didn't look too good in terms of walkability. I was staying there because I was attending a conference, and the organizers directed us to stay there. I had breakfast only one day. Breakfast supposedly ended at 10:30 am, and I got there just after 10 am. The server told me to hurry; she kept saying they closed at 10 am. (It is really 10:30 am.) The pickings were slim. Some things were out, some were low, and nothing was being replaced. I got the dregs.
